rtoot - Collecting and Analyzing Mastodon Data

Source: methodshub.md

Description

An implementation of calls designed to collect and organize Mastodon data via its Application Program Interfaces (API), which can be found at the following URL: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/.

Keywords

  • Mastodon
  • Decentralized Social Network
  • Social Media Data

Science Usecase(s)

Although not using this package, the data from the Mastodon API has been used in various social science publications on platform migration (e.g.¬†La Cava et al.¬†2023) and online network formation (e.g.¬†La Cava, et al.¬†2021).

Repository structure

This repository follows the standard structure of an R package.

Environment Setup

With R installed:

install.packages("rtoot")

Input Data

No applicable.

Sample Input and Output Data

As a data collection software, this tool does not have any ‚Äúsample input‚Äù.

The output from this software is a standard tibble of data collected from the Mastodon API.

How to Use

Please refer to the ‚ÄúIntroduction to rtoot‚Äù for a comprehensive introduction of the package.

In general, one should first conduct the authentication to obtain an access token. This can be done with the provided function auth_setup(). For more information, please refer to the documentation on authentication.

However, it is also possible to use some of functions with authentication. For example, it is possible to obtain the public timeline of a Mastodon instance, e.g.¬†emacs.ch.

library(rtoot)
get_timeline_public(instance = "emacs.ch")
# A tibble: 20 √ó 29

Other functions, e.g.¬†get_timeline_hashtag(), get_account_statuses() require authentication.
